Articles.Content:
IGN put Kerbal Space Program in its list of five ridiculous upcoming games. I don\'t know if that\'s good or bad, but I\'m glad to see KSP getting noticed more.

Found it here: http://pc.ign.com/articles/122/1223425p1.html

Publicity is good.

There\'s no denying our beloved KSP brings many ridiculous moments. I really like how the game is developing more towards the player choosing his own desired balance between a realistic sim and a bunch of silly explosions.

Nice!

And cool to read about the other games - the dinosaur one looks like a lot of fun..

Dinosaurs + guns + KSP = DINORIDERS IN SPAAAAAAAAAAAAACE

Nice! Of course the comments section is just one big flame war as usual, but it\'s amazing to see this 'obscure' indie game picking up steam in the gaming world. We might have another Minecraft situation on our hands.

We might have another Minecraft situation on our hands.

only if we can make it to the full mainstream, then this will happen.

Dinosaurs + guns + KSP = DINORIDERS IN SPAAAAAAAAAAAAACE

Maybe that's where the Kerbals came from...

Edited August 18, 2012 by willitstimothy

Publicity is good.

There\'s no denying our beloved KSP brings many ridiculous moments. I really like how the game is developing more towards the player choosing his own desired balance between a realistic sim and a bunch of silly explosions.

The right publisitiy is good. Bad publicity well, it gets the name out there, but doesn\'t do much good for the game.
That\'s where I found it and became interested XD

I wouldn\'t really have it down as ridiculous, whats odd about sending little green men into space?

But its good for publicity anyway..
